comments: The reviews can perhaps be best summed up by one student when he wrote, “good lecture, bad reading.”  The students, in many cases, found the professor to be great, but thought that the reading was “depressing,” too dry, complaining, and discouraging.  Although Professor Granieri was extremely well-liked (they felt that he was an “excellent lecturer,” enthusiastic, and humorous), students disliked the text book and readings.
